cause.description:
According to www.americanheart.org:
"-Cardiovascular diseases claimed 871,500 lives in 2004 (36.3 percent of all deaths or 1 of every 2.8 deaths). -Other 2004 mortality: total cancer 550,270; accidents 108,694; HIV (AIDS) 12,995. -Over 147,000 Americans killed by CVD are under age 65.
Stroke killed 150,147 people in 2004. It's the third largest cause of death, ranking behind "diseases of the heart" and all forms of cancer. Stroke is a leading cause of serious, long-term disability in the United States."
All of you probably know someone who has suffered from heart disease, a heart attack, or a stroke, and in the plight to better the lives of Americans, we must develop new and better ways of preventing and treating cardiovascular diseases and stroke.
If you don't know someone who has suffered from one of these conditions, you will. As our parents get older their risk increases everyday, and we must be ready and informed about these deadly diseases.
Go to www.americanheart.org and get informed.
1. Inform yourself about Cardiovascular diseases and stroke.
2. Learn Prevention techniques, such as eating right and exercising.
3. Learn the warning signs of a heart attack or stroke, and learn what steps you can take to save a life if someone you know is having a heart attack or stroke.
4. Donate to this well known national organization to help develop new treatments and prevention techniques for Cardiovascular diseases and stroke.
cause.mission: Build healthier lives, free of cardiovascular diseases and stroke.
